statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Jim Jackson made a 3-pointer with one second left Saturday night, giving the Miami Heat a 76-73 victory over Houston and extending the Rockets' losing streak to 13.
article.headline: Rockets fall at home to Heat as epic streak grows
article.linkText: Misfiring: Rockets fall for 13th straight time
article.story:
HOUSTON (AP) -- Jim Jackson's approach to the game-winning shot couldn't have been more basic. "I didn't even think about it. You go back to what you have been taught to do. You just catch and shoot," Jackson after hitting a 3-point shot with one second left to give the Miami Heat a 76-73 victory over Houston, extending the Rockets' losing streak to 13. Eddie Jones led the Heat with 19 points, followed by Jackson with 15 and Rod Strickland and Anthony Carter with 12 each. Miami Coach Pat Riley credited a pass from Jones with setting up the game-winning basket. "We wanted to go to Eddie (Jones) or Zo (Alonzo Mourning). (Oscar) Torres was sagging off of Jimmy and Eddie made a great pass to him," Riley explained. Torres admitted a defensive lapse. "The play was to switch up. My role was to go help and then shoot back, but I returned too late and he had the open shot," Torres said. It is only Miami's second road victory of the season. The Heat is 5-17. Houston, which was 7-5 before the losing streak began, is the first NBA team to reach 18 losses. Kenny Thomas led Houston with 26 points and 12 rebounds, while Cuttino Mobley had 17 points and Torres 12. Houston's losing streak is the longest in the NBA this season and the Rockets' worst since they dropped 13 straight during the 1977-78 season. The franchise's longest losing streak is 17 during the 1967-68 campaign. "They are all tough. I want them off the schneid so bad. Maybe I'm trying too hard, but I feel so bad for the team," Houston coach Rudy Tomjanovich said. "You can't have five guys out of the lineup and expect to be the same. We don't have a guy out, we have a whole bunch of guys out." Riley has sympathy for Tomjanovich. "It takes its toll on players and a team. My heart goes out to Rudy," Riley said. Thomas scored seven points in the opening minutes of the fourth period as Houston took a 61-59 lead with 7:36 left. The game was tied three times before the Heat grabbed a 69-65 advantage with 4:05 remaining. Houston pulled to 71-69 after a pair free throws by Mobley with 2:06 remaining. After a driving layup by Jones with 1:06 left gave the Heat a 4-point lead, Thomas hit a jump shot with 48 seconds left. Mobley's driving layup tied it at 73 with just six seconds left. Jackson then hit the game-winning shot from 25 feet out. Moochie Norris tried a desperation shot from midcourt that missed at the buzzer.

Game notes
Houston's Walt Williams didn't play because of back spasms. ... Houston has lost all 13 games this season which Steve Francis has missed because of injuries. ... Of Miami's 17 losses, 15 have been by single digits -- 11 by seven points or fewer. ... Miami scored 95 points or more in only two of its first 16 games but has surpassed that mark in two of its last six games.
